data.title: Tasty but slow service
data.text: We liked the downtown location, beer selection, and poutine! The poutine was delicious. It did seem like they were understaffed, and it took a long time to get our orders in and then to get our food. On the night we visited, there were a good number of patrons there but definitely not packed. It was not great timing for people who'd driven a long way to get to Spokane!

data.title: Great Beer and Burgers
data.text: Stopped here with my 17 year old son. We both went with their huge, delicious bacon cheeseburger. The hamburger was great, and despite some postings that say otherwise, we thought the meat had excellent flavor and perfect spicing. The beer menu is fantastic. Great place for a casual bite.

data.title: good place with great ambiance!  we really enjoyed our burgers! Friendly personel!
data.text: good place with great ambiance!  we really enjoyed our burgers - royal burger is strongly recommended! Friendly personel! Big screens everywhere with live baseball, fotball, hockey..

data.title: Fun brew pub
data.text: We went by on Saturday to watch the Coug game. The good news, they were packed with fans. The bad news, they were understaffed. we waited 30 minutes for our first beers. How ever they were served with a smile. The food was slow, but the quality was excellent. If you are watching a game, what is the hurry?

data.title: Best burger ever!
data.text: Visited this restaurant for 1st visit last week. The atmosphere is definitely 'pub', not a place for a quiet dinner. But the burgers my husband and I had were excellent, flavorful toppings, and buns that made it for the whole life of the sandwich! The homemade fries weren't quite to my liking (not as crisp as I like); next time I will try the sweet potato version. The beer selection was extensive.  Plenty of big - screen TVs for sports nights,  room for big groups.

data.title: Awesome draft selection!
data.text: Great sports bar in an awesome location! Our server was great and offered helpful draft selection advice, the nachos are so cheesy and amazing. Would recommend.

data.title: Fabulous Burgers & Service
data.text: We decided to eat at this place because it was a sports bar. The guys were happy with their beers and burgers were amazing. The french fries and sweet potato fries were also great. The workers were very friendly and very helpful. I believe we were in and out in about an hour. We we go back.

data.title: Good sports bar
data.text: We dashed in on a Saturday for a quick bite. Caught up on all the games, had a drink and burgers. Josh gave us speedy service along with good attention. Burger was ok. Sweet potato fries delicious as was the aioli that accompanied them. Total for 3 drinks, 1 entree, 1 app, small sweet potato fries was $75 including tip. We could have been more picky about ordering and spent less but we were in a hurry. We got fed and watered and got out on time with little hassle and a warm feeling. I think that's worth $75. Husband had bacon cheeseburger and I had the burger sliders.

data.title: Great addition to downtown
data.text: Formerly Sergios Sports Bar, this newly renovated space is comfortable.  The addition of the covered patio is a nice touch.  Lots of televisions and good music playing each time we've visited.  The service has been great, the food fantastic, and a good value for your dollar.  A nice varied menu from burgers to tacos to wraps, everything we've had has been excellent.  Full bar and 24 taps available.  If you're lucky, the shuffleboard table will be open on your visit to have some additional fun.  Oh yeah, the shuffleboard is free to all users.

data.title: Could be great!
data.text: Burger was good but not as it should have been. Some mushrooms cooked well, others raw. Slow service. Had to flag them down. Potential to be great though. I will try again!

data.title: Randy F
data.text: Stopped by 24 Taps while staying at the Davenport. The beer was great and so was the food. The service was wonderful as well.

data.title: Great food, excellent choice of beers on tap
data.text: While enjoying the downtown Spokane area we spotted the 24 Taps and oh my oh my made a great choice deciding to go in! Great food, great service, great people. Able to sample beers before purchase. The sports was great we had a personal speaker at our table, and the screen are perfect size.

data.title: Sports bar in downtown Spokane
data.text: Stopped in to watch the horse race and found a little gem of a sports bar in downtown Spokane......lots of beer selection and the menu had a lot of options too......lots of TV's throughout and a great vibe for a Saturday afternoon.

data.title: Great beer selection!
data.text:
Taps is the best place in town to watch sports games and have burgers and brews. Josh, the owner, is the best! Great customer service and awesome remodel. 
Their food menu is great and has a good variety and they have tons of local beers on tap. Would absolutely recommend to friends and family.

data.title: Great sports bar
data.text: Really like this place.  Great range of beers and a Poutine Burger, what more could you want.  Always found the staff friendly and helpful.

data.title: Awesome Sports Bar!
data.text: My Boyfriend and I went down to 24 taps the evening of Bloomsday 2016. What an awesome experience! Josh is an amazing person and very personable! He greeted and was very inviting to this awesome place! Thank you Josh for opening up such a sweet spot in Spokane You Rock!

data.title: Great Burgers and beer...NOT for families with small kids
data.text: The food was very good and a decent beer selection...but no kids menu.  No simple pbj, grilled cheese...nada.  The waiter said they did not like subsitutions from the menu.  He had to check to see if there was milk.   Total bummer.  Also they only have high bar seats and tall booths, which was hard for the kids. (The kids are 2, 4, 6).  Great food but don't take the kids!

data.title: Great Sportsbar
data.text: Fantastic choice of both beer and burgers, plus many other menu items.  Several televisions to watch different games simultaneously, great in football and basketball seasons

data.title: massive beer and burger bar , everything massive including prices
data.text: First time I went in there I waited around for someone to come over to me, after 5 minutes, no one did. No parking, you have to feed the meter quarters if you wanna park close by. that is if u can find a space. If one is a football worshiper and actually thinks bar food is good food. Then you may like it. Owner is arrogant and rude. I would not go back or if i did. I would not tip bartenders. I am not sure why delivering me a beer and a burger deserves a tip.

data.title: Great Atmosphere
data.text: We stopped here in a small group with a 1 year old as it was close to River Front Square. What a great stop! We watched the Patriots vs Kansas City playoff game and the atmosphere was great! It was clean and they stayed pretty busy between the 2 bartenders. They also have a shuffle board and TV's in the bathrooms. The food was really amazing. The double fried fries are some of the best homemade fries I've had in a long time and I could eat a plate of those now. Our group had Chicken Strips, Poutine Fries and a Poutine Burger. We'd have given them an excellent but the less beer we ordered, the less they came around. We had to go to the bar to get our tab and pay at once. We'd go back for sure!
